endemo2.utility.prediction_models.TimeStepSequence¶

class TimeStepSequence(historical_data, progression_data, calculation_type=ForecastMethod.LINEAR, rate_of_change=0.0)[source]¶

Bases: Timeseries

A variant of the timeseries class, where there is a forecast given in the shape of intervals with an exponential growth rate.

Parameters:

  • historical_data ([(float, float)]) – The historical data. Passed onto parent class.

  • progression_data ([(Interval, float)]) – The manual progression data in form of an interval in combination with the exponential growth rate.

  • calculation_type (ForecastMethod) – The forecast type, should the parent class be used instead. Is passed on to the parent class.

  • rate_of_change (float) – The rate of change for the exponential forecast method of the parent class, should the parent class be used for calculation and this method be selected.

Variables:

  • _his_end_value ((float, float)) – The last value of historical data used as a starting point for the exponential interval calculation.

  • _interval_changeRate ([(Interval, float)]) – The Interval-Change-Rate pairings that are used by the forecast calculation for this class.

get_manual_prog(target_x)[source]¶

Get the prognosis of the y-axis value for a target x-axis value from the manual exponential interval-growth-rate forecast.

\[y=s_x*(1+r_{1})^{(intvl^{(1)}_{b}-s_y)}*(1+r_{2})^{(intvl^{(2)}_{b}-intvl^{(2)}_{a})}*\text{...}*(1+r_{3})^ {(x-intvl^{(3)}_{a})}\]
Parameters:

target_x (float) – The target x-axis value.

Returns:

The predicted y value at x-axis value x.

get_value(target_x)¶

Get the y-axis value for a certain target_x. Combines historical data and prediction data. When historical data is available it is used. When not, a prognosis is made instead.

Parameters:

target_x – The target x-axis value.

Returns:

The corresponding y-axis value, historical or prognosis.
